alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 5:14AM EST until January 07 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Newberry and Saluda Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties. Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Columbia. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Old State Road, SC 66, below Cayce becomes flooded. At 19.0 feet, Extensive swampland and large areas of farmland and pasture land downstream from Columbia become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.0 feet early this morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
